message.content:
cs.GT, cs.DS, cs.LO, cs.AI, cs.CC 

Reasoning: The paper deals with the computational complexity of decision problems for one-counter simple stochastic games, which are turn-based stochastic games played on the transition graph of classic one-counter automata. This makes it likely to belong to the Game Theory (cs.GT) sub-category. Additionally, the paper involves the study of certain reward objectives, which could place it in the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. The use of one-counter automata suggests that the paper could also belong to the Data Structures (cs.DS) sub-category. The study of termination and limit problems could place it in the Logic in Computer Science (cs.LO) sub-category. Finally, the computational complexity analysis of decision problems could also make it relevant to the Computational Complexity (cs.CC) sub-category.
